website_summaries.verdict: The sound quality is adequate and comparable to similar models, but it is the superior portability of this model that earns it a spot on our list.
pros: The 30-millimeter driver offers little distortion at normal volume levels and is surprisingly loud for headphones this size
With a design that allows the unit to be folded, and one of the most lightweight models in JVC's line, this model offers excellent portability
Padding on the headphones and the headband make this unit comfortable enough for moderate periods of use
cons: The bass reproduction is not as clear on this model as some others, so users who need headphones which optimize bass sound may prefer a different model

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily.  I Don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: The earpiece broke immediately when taking out of package. I think the plastic was brittle and very narrow where the earpiece rotate on the band. Unfortunately they will not allow me to return it. The broke before I even got to try them. I will change my review if the seller replaces my item.
customer_reviews.author: A real Bona fide customer who bought this product with hard earned money

customer_reviews.title: The headphones sound great, however they're very poorly constructed
customer_reviews.text: The headphones sound great, however they're very poorly constructed. Within a week,both plastic spindles that attach the speakers to the headband physically broke at their respective bases.. As a workaround, I unscrewed the sides, replaced the broken plastic parts with wooden dowels (for rigidity) and then used electrical tape to secure the headphones in place. The MacGyvered improvisation is holding up better than manufacturer's design, but if I do end up replacing them, I won't be buying this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphones for workouts
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are excellent. I purchased them a few years ago to use when running or working out. They fit well and adjust easily. They don’t slip off when running or exercising and wipe clean afterward. The sound is crystal clear and great quality. They are very comfortable, and better for workouts than any pair of earbuds I have tired. I love that they easily fold flat for compact storage. They are durable, and I haven’t had any trouble with the sound or fit. I own both a red pair and a pink pair, and both are stylish and fun. They are definitely worth purchasing and would buy them again without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Calimeddy

customer_reviews.title: Good value but fragile
customer_reviews.text: I bought my son (14yo) and I each a pair of these for a trip we were taking. They sound pretty good for what they are... a cheap pair of over the ear headphones. I know you don't buy these expecting to replace your Sennheisers or Bose. That said... I don't recommend them for traveling. One of the speakers broke off my sons set while in his carry-on the second day out (not his fault). I still have mine but I've had to be very careful with them. I'm only going to use them around the house & office. I don't think I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: vicky regis

customer_reviews.title: Good, cheap lightweight headphones the can break quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Am revising my review after a replacement pair bought in Dec. 2017 started failing in three months. The wires attaching to the plug on the new ones came loose from the plug just as the earlier ones did, only this time it was a matter of three months instead of three years.. Can't recommend. Old review below. Had gotten the wife a pair of these years ago. Won't please audiophiles but they are very comfortable which is what she is concerned with while watching her cat videos. The heavy insulation near the plug came apart, prompting the replacement. The old ones still work, but don't have any electrical tape. Will save it as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: MikeG

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when opening the package
customer_reviews.text: Damaged the wires while opening the incredibly user-hostile, hard plastic package. Never had this happen before. Ordered another set, will probably hire a professional to open the package this time.
customer_reviews.author: Doubtless Thomas

customer_reviews.title: false reviews
customer_reviews.text: this product is cheap so don't expect any quality no bass or highs nothing but mid range. Product would be perfect to listen to audio books but not for music. not worth the money consider this a warning purchase something with better quality
customer_reviews.author: rommel de los reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have fussy ears, and I'm on a budget. JVC doesn't fail with these sweet little headphones. I just use them to practice my keyboard piano, and would rather not submit my neighbors to repetitive exercises and songwriting. I'm that person who you're never sure if they're even home. Well, unless I start singing. Then my cover is blown. Oh, I wasn't sure about the noise cancelling, because I could hear the sound coming out of them, but it was muffled. That's OK for my purposes, and I'm cursed with the kind of super sonic hearing that drives me to wear ear plugs at night. Anyway, buy these!
customer_reviews.author: VJErwood

customer_reviews.title: GREAT headphones for the price.  Period.
customer_reviews.text: SUMMARY: GREAT headphones for the price. Period. PROS: Great sound. Expand to accommodate even those with HUGE heads (like me). Normally, headphones are a tight fit, but I have MUCH room to spare in these! CONS: The only con is that the lay-flat earpieces make me skeptical about the longevity of the product, as they feel "loose." But, I will trust that JVC knows what it is doing! If they fall apart, I will certainly come back and update.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Adams

customer_reviews.title: Father's BDay GIFT
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a birthday gift for my father and he loves them! SO affordable and so nice! they were highly rated on C-NET! that's how i found them! You don't have to spend a lot to get a good product i believe and this demonstrates that perfectly! The only problem is everybody wants to use them lol I need to buy more! And i love seeing him use them everyday!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound but cheap price
customer_reviews.text: I took these on a six month journey through South America and they held up well in a little case for my Kindle that was stuffed into my backpack- the kindle however didn't survive as well and has a cracked screen. Good sounding headphones to wear that don't eat up your battery life, just slightly bigger than ear buds but more comfortable, and probably more hygienic for long trips since you aren't sticking the directly into your ear canal. Unfortunately they don't cancel noise nor do they have a microphone on the wire, but for basic headphones these have been worth the price and I wouldn't worry too much if they do break or get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Lomatium

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up, and earphone cover looks replaceable if need be
customer_reviews.text: Already have several of these, got this pair for my son to keep at school to use during chrome book time. They are great, comfortable, outside the ears which I like, pleased with product. Update: let my son borrow them and he ended up picking at the faux leather earphone cushions. I read in the questions that they aren’t replaceable. Well they work fine otherwise so I investigated and I got the cover off & I found replacement covers here on amazon, with decent ratings, for like $6, they look just like what I pulled off here, so I’m going to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Super light, durable and decent sount
customer_reviews.text: The heading says it all. I typically get headphones in the $65 range. They typically fall apart within 6 months. My last pair would put a dent in the top of my head while gaming or watching a movie. I bought this pair as an emergency backup due to the mortality rate of previous headphones. It is now my preferred headphones. There is no noise cancellation with this headphone. The headphones I have had with noise cancellation were a disappointment at best.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G.

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: I love these and will be ordering them in different colors. Several people have asked where I got them AMAZON THE BOMB .COM! They're small and sleek I bought a larger pair of headphones from a retail store because I got so tired of sticking the small earbuds in my ear, which tend to make your ears sweat and itch in the summer heat. But these are much better and fit better on ears and in bags, the earbuds fold flat and the sound quality especially the bass is amazing! I kept looking down the length of the cord to see if there was a "Base boost" button nope just great sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Softball G.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SOUND, LIGHT WEIGHT, LOW $$$
customer_reviews.text: Very nice headphones; you can’t beat these for the price. Sound quality, for my ears, is just fine. I’m sure that $100, or $200, or $500 headphones probably sound better than these. But do they sound $100, or $200, or $500 better? Not for me. Nice & light, easy to wear for long periods of time, and perfect for listening on a portable music player (I’ve never liked earbuds). Also, I’ve used several other small headphones like these, and I had to turn up the player all the way up to get a reasonable listening level. These have excellent output. For anybody looking for small, light, inexpensive headphones, I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: George Sawyn

customer_reviews.title: Did their job, good value
customer_reviews.text: These lasted about 11 months with my daughter. She's rough on headphones, so this is not a dig at JVC at all. I chose not to replace them with another set, though. I decided on a larger Koss pair for about the same price. It's a somewhat arbitrary decision and I could easily buy these again some day. So, what went wrong with this pair? The wires soldered to the right ear speaker became frayed inside the housing somehow and were intermittently shorting, causing static sounds. The left ear speaker itself sustained damage somehow.
customer_reviews.author: pog

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: These are a super value for the price. I play with a musical group every week and the in-ear monitors were killing my ears so I thought I would try these. The sound they provide is excellent--very comparable to the $100 in-ears! They are "low profile" so I don't look like a total weirdo on-stage. They also pivot to lay flat so they pack up neatly in my gig-bag.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair I have bought for my son. For the price, he is very happy with them. They are light weight, have a good sound and well they must cancel outside noise because when he is wearing them I have to scream at him to get his attention. The first pair lasted a long time and when they finally broke I pordered another. Are they the best? well of course not but if you don't need anything fancy or perfect sound then I recommend. Another note, my son has complained about other types and brands of headphones hurting him, he has never complained about these
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jamron

customer_reviews.title: Impressed for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on here that talked about how good the earphones were for on-the-ears and the price plus and decided to give a try before going for the more expensive over-the-ear ones that I know will be outstanding quality. I am indeed with how good they are with bass even! Not tinny sounding. They are not perfect, of course, and won't even compare with over-the-ears. You don't get knocked out by super heavy bass but on a budget, I say go for them. Tried them out on my computer and cell phone with a couple of Country songs, Black Sabbath, Metallica and Tupac and pretty darned good! (Love all genres of music)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great small headphones for my laptop
customer_reviews.text: Great performance and looks. onlly negative is the length of the cable on them. Cable is only about 40" long - should be at least 6 ft for use on a lap top. Sound is outstanding and the cushioned ear pads are quite comfortable. Noise cancellation is fair but can still hear my wife ask a question while wearing them, I guess that should be a GOOD THING huh?
customer_reviews.author: TexasClan

customer_reviews.title: Finally!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd never find a decent set of Headphones..No matter what the price.Amazon was probably ready to cut me off with the returns of others.When I found "Koss" I thought no-brainer.Nope!!!Always had Luck with Panasonic.Nope!!Saw these JVC and remembered these from my Teenage years.Bingo!!!Great crisp sound in all sound ranges.There is always something missing but they Nailed it with these and they didn't break the bank.No more Returns unless my Sister sits on these like she did on my Amazon Basics.I went to reorder those but they were Unavailable.Story of my Life.Im Good...Peace and Happy Listening.
customer_reviews.author: Charlane Valade

customer_reviews.title: The best "cheap" headphones you'll ever use.
customer_reviews.text: For less than $20, I wasn't expecting much. I just needed a very basic pair of headphones to use with my PC. What a surprise I discovered when I plugged them into my smartphone and cranked some AC/DC. The sound quality for the price really kicked me in the butt. Mids/highs are punchy, but not overly crisp with a nice bass response. I wouldn't want to use them for high fidelity listening, but man, they're nice for general/basic/casual listening. Also lightweight and very comfortable. I'll buy another set when these play their last note.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Headphones worked great for a little over two months
customer_reviews.text: Headphones worked great for a little over two months. Then one side stopped working. Adult owned. Used for listening to audio books while typing. Contacted seller, who stated to contact the manufacturer. Contacted the manufacturer who stated to go through the seller. Get the picture now? Wasn't worth the time to go jump through hoops to figure out who's going to take accountability for the product. Threw them out. I did like the way they folded flat and the sound was decent.
customer_reviews.author: JVrac

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable pair of headphones I’ve ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I go through headphones quickly. Either they are too uncomfortable to wear or poorly made. I bought these because I wear headphones to watch TV, so I was looking for a pair of lightweight and large headphones. I have a bigger head, so some headphones don’t fit me. These are great little headphones. They are comfortable and the sound is great! For $12, you can’t find a better pair!
customer_reviews.author: J. Neditch

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long at all
customer_reviews.text: We purchased several pairs of these headphones and were very disappointed in them. After having them and using them for just a little over a month they started to break, all of them in the same spot!! It wasn’t so much breaking I should say, but that the wires kept coming disconnected from the plug, so then you would lose sound. They were pretty inexpensive, so I gave it 2 stars because for the month I had them they were good, they just didn’t last long at all.
customer_reviews.author: Keene Family

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to try out something other than earbuds for an International flight. I struggle with spending $300 on a set of really good headphones, so I thought this would be a bit of a cheap proof of concept. They're ok. Just ok, though a good portion of that could be that I apparently do not care much for on-ear headphones. They're also cheap enough that when I forgot them on the plane I was ok with having left them behind... they won't really be missed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Very glad to find these again
customer_reviews.text: After using them 5 years I finally broke my first pair (not their fault). Sound superb for the money if you don't want booming base. Crisp sound with adequate low range. Light and comfortable. Gave three stars for durability because they ARE lightweights: just don't try to drag the your notebook off the table with them and they'll last 5 years like my first pair did.
customer_reviews.author: Kalahari Survivor

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: For the money, these are great little headphones. Very light weight, comfortable, and sound really good. Small and easy to take with you. I cannot use ear buds. I am not rough with my things, so have never had a pair break. Got a pair for my granddaughter too. I use these for my phone and my tablet. Have another pair I use with my Yamaha keyboard. Have tried several high priced headphones, and I still go back to these. Wired headphones always sound better than bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: mldal

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price - not cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are not the best that money can buy, but then again, I knew that before I purchased them. For their size and weight, I think they do pretty well overall. The sound is surprisingly loud and fairly clear for their price-point. They fold down flat and are easy to fit in a small bag or case. I purchased them just for their portability, but was surprised by their comfort and fairly decent sound quality, and overall build quality is decent. I'm glad I bought these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: wile_coyote7

customer_reviews.title: Believe the hype
customer_reviews.text: These really do "sound better than they have any business sounding" for the price. They aren't studio quality, but they sound very good. The only drawback for me has been that they squeeze my head a little too tight for long-term wear – they start to hurt after about an hour. I don't think I have an exceptionally big head, but I do wear pretty thick-rimmed glasses, so that could be a factor.
customer_reviews.author: Skybondsor

customer_reviews.title: Just Note This One Detail
customer_reviews.text: Although in the pictures, it looks as though these headphones encircle one's ears, they do not. They are so small that they rest directly on your ears and after a while, your ears will hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Clarke Waldron

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the best portable headphones in this price range that I have ever owned. The sound quality is hard to beat, with decent low frequencies and very clear high frequencies. They haven't fallen apart after one year of heavy use. The one thing I don't like is the flat folding gimmick. It is inconvenient to have them swivel forward when on my ears. If I flip the left and right sides, the swivel mechanism isn't a problem but the stereo sound is reversed. I am tempted to superglue them in place. Freq Response: 12Hz - 24kHz Sensitivity: 103dB/mW Impedance: 32 ohms Cord length: 1.2m
customer_reviews.author: Mathew M Reich

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable and lightweight headphones
customer_reviews.text: For our lengthy SE Asia trip I wanted to find a decent headphone set that covered the ear rather than using earbuds. So I bought this and I'm glad I did. They sound great, are comfortable, fold nicely, and are really lightweight. In other words, they did everything I had hoped. I strongly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: DougH

customer_reviews.title: Shorted in just a few months
customer_reviews.text: All lightweight wired headphones usually get the common short issue eventually. Past brands I had over the years would last a couple years before they start shorting out. But these JVC headphones started shorting after just 3 months of usage. When they were working, the sound quality is on par with all the other brands. Nothing spectacular, but serves its purpose. The headset adequately stays on the head and not uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Curt M

customer_reviews.title: Sound Quality Is Great
customer_reviews.text: I am hard of hearing in one ear. I used a Sony headset and the sound was not as clear as the JVC headset. In fact I use these on my kindle while streaming and my phone too. The sound is magnified more. I am so please with this headset. It has made hearing so much better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Denver52

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, good price!
customer_reviews.text: Remarkable sound for the small price. Very lightweight. Doesn't interfere with wearing glasses. Seem comfortable although I haven't had them on for an extended period. Better than earbuds. In my opinion. Because they are very lightweight I think they could break easily if handled roughly. Not noise canceling, in other words, with just the headphones on and no sound, doesn't block noise, but with music on, you can hardly hear anything else. Definitely worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: carman96

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SOUND QUALITY FOR THE PRICE
customer_reviews.text: These served the purpose of providing excellent sound quality at an affordable price. Lightweight but durable. Crisp sound, like what you would expect from a JVC. Not great for noise cancelling but "okay," however this was not an important facet for me in it's purchase. Cannot control the volume, which might be a negative for some. Again, this was not a big deal for me given its excellent sound quality for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Scoobie

customer_reviews.title: iPhone compatible plug not compatibale with PCs
customer_reviews.text: Note that if you use this on a Windows laptop with a single audio jack for headphones, the iPhone compatible plug will make Windows detect a headset with a microphone, and automatically switch off your array microphone. Since the headphone has no microphone, the end result is that if you then try to video conference or use an application like Skype, you will not be heard unless you manually switch back to using the array microphone. This does not happen with a regular, non-iPhone compatible, headset plug.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great to Use for Sound Therapy Healing
customer_reviews.text: Most of the tine, I use these inexpensive headphones for sound therapy. Universal Sound Therapy is a company that offers different sound frequencies for treating various health issues. These headphones are small and flexible enough so they can be comfortably placed on virtually any part of your body that you want to heal. For example, I position the JVC headphones face down on my arthritic knee and play the Injured Knee Therapy using my IPad so the sound frequencies penetrate through that area to provide healing. I also use the headphones on my sciatic region using Sciatic Therapy and my stomach region using Inflammation Therapy.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Butterfield

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Really great headphones for an unbelieveable price. I bought these because of the other good reviews. There are great headphones out there without paying a fortune, but you never know until you get them home. These headphones are amazing! The sound is sharp and clear. All tones coming through well together. Meaning if you want headphones that are mainly base, these are NOT for you. But if you want to hear all levels of music these are great. The price, unbelieveable. Very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: nethop

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: These are nice headphones with regard to sound quality. However, headphones of this kind do tend to malfunction fairly easily in some way or another. I opt for headphones from JVC because their customer service is outstanding. They promptly respond to issues covered by their warranty. So I am confident that they stand by their product.
customer_reviews.author: Game Changer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Office
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use at my office desk. The fit is very comfortable with the smaller pads fitting right over the ear. Conversations around me are muzzled while the sound is clear and just enough bass to get the full range of the music or voices playing through. Best feature, if using these earphones with a cell or tablet that has a protective cover; is the small diameter of the connector housing, no problems with complete insertion and hold..
customer_reviews.author: Todd Hopp

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, light weight, and durable!
customer_reviews.text: My son would burn through head phones at an alarming rate. I got him a blue pair of these and he got a good 8 months out of them before breaking them. I started buying these regularly for him. I bought these red ones for my daughter, and she loved them! They are light weight, easy to store because of the swivel ear piece, bright vivid colors, and the sound is fantastic! They are so comfortable that both kids forget that they have them on! and my daughter wears glasses! My son has been known to fall asleep in them! I can attest to the durability as well! I won't buy any other brand now!
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan Mulligan

customer_reviews.title: Bright and well-balanced sound
customer_reviews.text: This have a bright, well-balanced sound without either the over-filtered or bass-heavy qualities I abhore. I listen to audio books on them at the gym and they're well-suited--and plenty loud--for that (they would also work well for jazz and classical listening). That said, the fit is fairly light and won't work for any activity where you head is tossed about, e.g. rhumba.
customer_reviews.author: Tj Pierce

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that I've gone through a number of these headphones due to my being clumsy and the fact that they're not built to withstand drops and accidental tugs on the cord, but for the price and sound quality you can't beat them. I'm strongly considering buying another pair because I love them so much. I rated the noise canceling at 3 stars because that's not what they do (unless you really crank up the volume) but overall they really deliver music clearly and the bass is very good also.
customer_reviews.author: Tianna D.

customer_reviews.title: 5 being best Comfort 3-4 (they are small
customer_reviews.text: They are ok... They are a bit too bias'd with treble and lack bass, but they are small. I will be returning them. Based on 1-5, 5 being best Comfort 3-4 (they are small, but there is some pressure) Bass Sound 2 (lacks bass) Treble Sound 3 Looks 4 Overall Design 3 (better if wires only on one side instead of both)
customer_reviews.author: ShadowyGoon

customer_reviews.title: Audiophile Approved!
customer_reviews.text: So I was looking for cheap headphones that my ears would be happy with! These are perfect for me! Please understand that there are people who judge sound by bass alone and there are people like me that like to hear everything. These have a very pleasing flat sound with bass still being present but not booming. I can almost compare the sound to my more expensive sennheiser that I use for mixing. The vocals and instruments sit right where I'd like it but these are lightweight and I can throw them in my bag on my travels. Can't speak on durability but I'm usually careful with my things. Let's see how long these last :D
customer_reviews.author: Xargus

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP BUT GOOD
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint is that they are cheaply made and break easily. Handle with care. The sound is very good. They are small and the cup doesn't cover the ear, so it doesn't block out as much sound as full can headphones, but you'll pay more for those. These are great if you need lots of pairs, or just need on cheap pair. I bought another pair, one for home and one for the field.
customer_reviews.author: thedvguy

customer_reviews.title: OK while they lasted.
customer_reviews.text: I work in an open office, which gets loud. I bought these to listen to music and try to block out some of the uproar. They were decent at that, but the design’s not good—they slid around on my head no matter how much I adjusted them. Then one of the ear pads came off. They lasted maybe a month. Big waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: AR Vegan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for sleeping
customer_reviews.text: Not fancy, sound quality is about a B+, definitely not noise cancelling, but if you can’t comfortably sleep with earbuds, these cheap headphones do the trick. Comfortable for side sleepers if your pillow is soft enough. I purchase them about twice a year, as the cable tends to wear at the jack/plug end. (Could be reinforced with tubing or other gadget to prolong life, I suppose.) Can’t live without ‘em.
customer_reviews.author: North O'Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality for inexpensive headphones
customer_reviews.text: I think I've had these headphones for about three years now and am fairly satisfied with them. I keep them in a separate pocket in my backpack which I always take to work with me and they're always being banged around, so I'm happy they've lasted this long. Overall, they still work fine and sound great for inexpensive headphones. The main problem I have with these headphones is that the wire tends to always twist up in the same direction and the outer material of the ear cushions has started to fray/disintegrate. But, for $13-14 bucks I can't complain too much about this since they've pretty much held up for me otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: drlarch

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Fine so far, but I've only had it a short while. I'm only using for talk/news radio on my little Sony Walkman so the sound quality really doesn't matter but it seems plenty fine, not tinny or scratchy at all. Those little ear buds hurt my ears, so this is much more comfortable. They are very lightweight, which I really like, but I don't think they can handle rough usage.
customer_reviews.author: Creaky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, easy to carry and pack, lightweight and cute!
customer_reviews.text: A real bargain for exercise gym or travel earphones. Excellent sound quality in those situations. Lightweight and easy to pack. These are not heavy duty earphones with thick wires so they need to be treated with care if they are to last. If you leave them somewhere, you won’t miss them because they’re cheap, you will miss them because they are very very good.And they fit me very well.
customer_reviews.author: Beltway Rider

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable, with surprisind sound quality.
customer_reviews.text: They won’t make me forget my $250 sennheisers but the Sound quality was better than expected. Light and very comfortable. Like the way the ear pads swivel to allow them to fir flat to your ear, which even my Sennheiser doesn’t do. They are great when listening on your phone or tablet out in public places. Liked them so well I bought 2.
customer_reviews.author: Harold E. Wright Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The room will hear everything too...
customer_reviews.text: I see a lot of decent reviews, and I thought for the price I'd go for it. Unfortunately they sound best when you use your hands to constantly press them up against your ears. They don't cup your ears whatsoever, they just sit on them, so yes, anyone in the room will hear what your listening to as well. These will be nothing more than an emergency backup for my earbuds and my Sony MDR-V150's.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound for the price and the ear peace swivels.
customer_reviews.text: Light and comfortable, I use these a lot more than my more expensive headset. I have repurchased these several times so I can keep them in various places (e.g. in the car or at an office if I am listening to a Kindle Fire movie while waiting). I have purchased many over ear and in ear headsets, and this is the one I use most often. My wife loves them also.
customer_reviews.author: Nannie McPhee

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive headphones, but no phone controls as indicated.
customer_reviews.text: Current listing (09/2019) denotes having iOS controls/mic on these headphones and I can definitely confirm this is not the case. Just a normal set of headphones. That aside, they are really decent for the cost. They have good sound, pretty comfortable, and, while not exceptionally durable in feel/appearance, travel well if you take a bit of care to protect them. Depending on fit, probably a good option for kids too as they are so inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Flowers

customer_reviews.title: just right
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a "sound" snob but like a headset for travel that doesn't require me to put ear buds into my ears, which irritates my ears for some reason. these are great. so great they have been stolen from me by my husband who is wearing them as I write this, watching his iPad, and NOT disturbing me because they are nice and quiet and do the job
customer_reviews.author: Gin

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It has great sound, and a nice look. The only drawback is it's kind of tight on my head and starts hurting my ears after a bit. I'm sure there's a way to fix this I just haven't figured it out yet.
customer_reviews.author: bamit

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: For the price I wasn't sure what the quality of these headphones would be, to my surprise, they are fantastic! Great sound quality and they cancel out noise which improves the experience. I can't do earbuds so was thrilled to find they still sell over the ear headphones, really solid product. My daughter thinks they are great too so I will be ordering her a set for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Sienna Love

customer_reviews.title: The sound is fine, the earopads are just right for my smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: The sound is fine, the earopads are just right for my smaller sized ears. I sleep with my earphones on because I'd rather treat my insomnia with audiobooks rather then drugs! I gave 4 stars because I'm a side sleep. I have a fluffy pillow that allows me to shape a little trough for my ear and I sleep on my side just fine. I do wish you could conform the shape of the band over the top as it is a bit stiff and because it doesn't conform to my head shape perfectly, it does have a tendency to slide. However, if your a back sleeper, these are just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kozmic Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones, good quality, small, and light.
customer_reviews.text: JVC HAS160P. Needed these for my kid (for school). I was skeptical about purchasing them, but did so because they were good brand and I bet on it. I can now say that the bet was good. For what it was needed - they are absolutely perfect. My kid likes them, I sometimes borrow them, too. Of course, they are not large headphones so don't expect lots of bass from them, but for an average user that is trying to find small headphones - they are good quality and provide sound that other alternatives would not. Overall, it was a good buy for me.
customer_reviews.author: bar123

customer_reviews.title: Usually these are good!
customer_reviews.text: For an inexpensive and very portable (foldable) pair of headphones, these are quite good - usually. Our family has bought several and we've been happy with them. They don't last forever, but with care you might get several years' use. The latest purchase stopped working just a couple weeks after purchase, although there are no visible defects. Amazon quickly replaced. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Versicolor

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit
customer_reviews.text: These headphones look and sound great, BUT, I think the product model was an average man's head. As a woman, I found the headphones too large; the pads slipped off my ears. It took me a few minutes to come up with an acceptable position towards the back of my head. I got these because they were recommended for glasses wearers, and I admit, they're comfortable once in position. Unfortunately, they come off upon a jerky movement, so they're not very practical for me.
customer_reviews.author: K. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: I buy them again and again
customer_reviews.text: I buy these headphones about every year and a half. I use them with my kindle at night when I go to bed. They're not bad headphones, the only reason I have to buy them again and again is bcuz I eventually end up ruining the cord in my sleep. I do find them quite comfy to sleep in and also use them on planes. They're louder than my earbuds which is also nice.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: My best choice for portable
customer_reviews.text: Good: affordable, sound quality good for both music *and* voice, comfortable, padding has some slight external noise dampening effect, when slipped mostly off-ear sound drops off rapidly rather than requiring full removal (e.g. to listen to someone (was a problem with a previous brand I had)). Could use improvement: maybe slightly strengthen the wire connection at earphone (since inevitably cord gets caught on things and tugged on over its lifespan).
customer_reviews.author: Batch4444

customer_reviews.title: How do I love them? Let me count the ways
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Comfortable for long wear. Cheap enough it won’t kill you to replace if they get broken or something. I have a pair at home and I take a pair with me to work. At $9 each I can do that ! I use them all day long at work. Can’t recommend enough. Sound is great. Price point is irrelevant to the great sound. Sound is great and price point is a perq! Get more than one.
customer_reviews.author: Yellowsky16

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound but wrong way folding flat
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound but a lot smaller on the ear than pictured. Also, they fold flat the wrong direction. With movement they fold off towards your face. They should fold back towards the ears as the ears naturally move them forward. I wear them backwards with music but not with a video/movie where the right left sound is important.
customer_reviews.author: Petoskey Bill

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these over 6 1/2 years ago, and they're still working great, no static, etc. I use them while running. I previously bought Sony headphones in the same price range, but they repeatedly stopped working within a year due to the low quality wires (I even tried mending them with a repair kit.) While the JVC build quality is great, I find they have quite a lot of bass, more so than the Sony, whose clarity I prefer. Also, the JVC headphones are not very comfortable, as the tension of the metal strap is firm. However, because of the overall quality, I won't hesitate to buy them again (and actually have bought a second set.)
customer_reviews.author: tampanews

customer_reviews.title: Delicate construction
customer_reviews.text: After a month of my son carting these around in his school bag, the metal band detached from inside the plastic attached to the ear pieces on one side, making the metal band slide completely out. Thankfully, nothing was actually broke and could be put back together after taking some of it apart. Works like new, but definitely not for traveling with.
customer_reviews.author: A Briggs

customer_reviews.title: What I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like ear buds. For me they are uncomfortable and when I run or work-out they are always falling out. I understand that over the ear phones are also safer for the ears and JVC has always made solid products. For the price these are perfect! I don't worry if they get sweat on them, they sound great, and are very comfortable AND...they stay on when I run! 10-10 under $10
customer_reviews.author: HKClassical

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, comfortable, good quality headphones
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. Wanted an over the ear, not in the ear kind, and these deliver great quality sound for a very reasonable price. They are comfortable to wear and come in fun colors. I like mine in the royal blue and the color is true to the picture. Great for listening to my music, audiobooks, and podcasts on the plane, at the pool, or on a walk.
customer_reviews.author: LKD

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with the sound quality for a $10 set of headphones. Although they're not noise cancelling, the sound quality was quite good I felt for the price I paid. They are very lightweight and comfortable to wear although I was careful storing them as I can see how they may break easily. I like how they fold flat and have a pouch to carry them in.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: SOUND SPECTACULAR
customer_reviews.text: I always heard JVC was good brand and took chance. I was not sure the plug would fit my Fire HD-8. When I received, I was impressed - light weight, cushioning is quality and the sound, wow! So rich and better than the theater. I am glad I made the right choice and the price is very reasonable. Obviously, the headphone plug fit...8-)
customer_reviews.author: Staci

customer_reviews.title: Work well, fold up nicely
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a lot of these headphones because the price is right, and my kids have broken a number of them by throwing them into the bottom of their backpacks. They need headphones for use in school. (I've now purchased a headphones case to protect these from damage.) We travel with these for use on airplanes because they fold up well and are small.
customer_reviews.author: Triple S

customer_reviews.title: Decent headphones, terrible packaging
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are reasonably comfortable and the sound quality is decent. I'll probably keep them but was seriously considering returning them because the packaging they use is that horrible, sealed, hard plastic that is nearly impossible to open - let alone trying to open it without cutting yourself on the plastic. Overall, decent quality headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Big Sound and good price. Perfect for laptops!
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. They are lightweight, foldable and comfortable on ear headphones. These have awesome sound quality and are not bulky at all. I store them in my laptop bag to use for schoolwork for online classes. I have used them when watching videos for my classes, and even with the tv on in the same room I can still hear perfectly. The sound quality is great, nice bass sound. They aren’t completely noise canceling but that can be accounted for by raising the volume. Good price, portable, great sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Trudi Jackson

customer_reviews.title: I love these, but my cat also loves the taste of the cord.
customer_reviews.text: These are my all-time favorite headphones. I bought a pair in-store at a local chain 5 years ago and they lasted 4 years. The leather cushions are awesome at blocking out noise and the quality is great. It's a simple design that I hope never gets "upgraded" into a fancier design with cheaper quality. Unfortunately, I've bought these 3 times off Amazon since my old pair, because they're also my cat's favorite thing to chew through. Still my favorite headphones, though!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable for the long haul flight
customer_reviews.text: I bought theses because they were oblong and not thick on the top. I thought they were ridiculous when they came, but wore them on a 9 hour flight and were perfect. They are not noise cancelling but was not expecting that for the price. They were so comfortable and compact. I always have a problem with the ones that go in my ear causing pain, I have had the chunky over the ears and those always hurt the top of my head and ears. These are a perfect fit for the long haul flight.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Goerke

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Headset
customer_reviews.text: Very nice little headset for the price. Just right for grade-school kids (too small for my big adult head). Over-the-head piece is a bit flimsy, but I've found that with many expensive 'adult' headphones too. For the value you can't beat them. I've had many other items by JVC and have found them to be reliable over the years. A nice pair in contrast to your everyday students' headphones.
customer_reviews.author: bwalk

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after seeing it reviewed by cnet.com; at the time, they said these were the best sounding headphones for the money. And they were correct; at this price, you're not likely to find headphones that sound better. The one drawback is the same with every other pair of on-ear headphones I've tried: even after making adjustments, they were irritating. After prolonged periods of use, they become downright painful. I'd recommend going with earbuds, or over-ear headphones. I bought thein a store, and they sound pretty good to me, as well as being much more comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT 32 OHM RADIO OPERATOR HEADSET
customer_reviews.text: DID RESEARCH BEFORE BUYING, TECSUN SHORTWAVE RADIOS USE 32 OHM IMPEDANCE EAR BUDS, THIS HEADSET WORKS AMAZING ON ANY TECSUN SHORTWAVE, ALSO WORKS VERY WELL ON RADIWOW AND V115 RADIOS
customer_reviews.author: todd schmitt

customer_reviews.title: JVC IS THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: Why pay hundreds of $$$'s for headphones when you can buy these JVC's?? Sound quality is great, nice colors & they feel comfortable! JVC proves that Yeezy + Beats = BS.
customer_reviews.author: sprint

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly great! I purchased these for a long trip this past summer and they held up well in my back pack thanks to the folding earpiece feature. The sound was good enough for audio books, podcasts, etc via my cell phone in airports, on highways, trains, and planes (except over the engines). I've been using them regularly for four months with no problems. Highly recommend and will buy again when necessary. UPDATE: These lasted over two years of daily use and many travels. One headphone just went out, but at this price I and quality I feel I've gotten a great bargain and I'm replacing them with the same kind.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They broke way to quickly and no sound
customer_reviews.text: They worked ok for a while. They were for my elderly mom and she needs headphones to be able to watch her shows. They worked ok but eventually her putting them on one side broke and then the other soon after. The sound stopped work on one side. And then the other. They aren't a great purchase. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Anointed77

customer_reviews.title: Great for piano and guitar practice.
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight very good sound response and frequency range. They aren’t “high end” headphones but also don’t cost as such. Perfect for my use case, electronic piano and guitar practice. I haven’t tried using them for listening to prerecorded music but I think they would sound decent for that as well.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Hill

customer_reviews.title: They're OK, but won't last long
customer_reviews.text: I got these given the endorsement by many, they're fine for casual listening, but the vinyl over the foam eventually gives out after a coupla years - right where they are connect on the inside edge. Did it on both I had. They are still usable however, but know these are cheaply made and priced accordingly. Note: as they are on-ear, don't expect any noise reduction and base response is so-so.
customer_reviews.author: Pboss

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and folds flat
customer_reviews.text: Because Im a student, I need headphones to be in the lab. My Panasonic lightweight phones had excellent audio but were hard to keep in my backpack. These JVC have nice sound and fold flat as well, making them much easier to store in my backpack. However, living in Hawaii with high temps and high humidity makes the noise-cancelling "muffs" a bit uncomfortable when hot and sticky. My ear actually sweats under them.
customer_reviews.author: sojourner

customer_reviews.title: The very best headphones all around!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this amazing headphones and shortly after got another pair of these JVC Flats! I loved them so much! The sound is superb - everything in such a great balance! Remarkable highs - up to 24khz! Bass is solid and clean, not overpowering and muddy! Highly recommend it to everyone - you can't go wrong with JVC!
customer_reviews.author: Rem Djemilev

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, comfortable headphones
customer_reviews.text: JVC headphones have always been reliable for me. I had my previous pair for eight years, and they still worked fine. I bought these only because the foam was wearing off of the old pair. It was time for new ones. The sound is perfect for me because I'm not into a lot of bass. These seem to fall right in the middle for sound--equal bass and treble, just how I like it. I use these mostly while hiking, and they are comfortable and definitely hold up for many miles. I am very pleased with JVC's headphones.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzy_slippers

customer_reviews.title: Quality sound at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these a couple of years ago and they were great. I moved up to a full size set(when I lost the JVC) which sounded great but had trouble with the plug in, but I couldn't find a pair of the JVC locally. So I ordered from Amazon. the quality is still great, the sound is still great. Lightweight, easy to carry/pack around. you can't beat the quality sound for the price. They compare favorably to a full size set but not the full size bulk. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Waterhouse

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones at night when I am in bed listening to music, or watching a movie. The flat nature of the ear piece allows to you to lay down with the headphones on without too much bulk and the overhead band keeps the ear pieces in place. I had another pair for several years before they broke. I liked them so much I purchased two sets.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Sager

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive headphones
customer_reviews.text: It does block out alot more background noise than earbuds or other inexpensive headphones. Though it's more for home indoor use as it can slip off and gets a bit sweaty in warmer temps. I had bought this similar model before a few years ago and it seems to run a bit smaller now and tighter, though I could still bend the metal a bit to make it more comfortable and not press so much on the top of my head.
customer_reviews.author: Erica I. Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great for use with iPod
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are a perfect match for the Apple iPod. My 'Nano' reproduces the jazz tunes I listen to with great fidelity, but the output, through earbuds, is flat; the bass response is just above the minimum. Trying to compensate with a pair of ear-covering headphones brought about exactly the opposite response: the music turned very bass-y, but not crisp, with muffled frequencies. The JVCs are just right: because they don't cover the ear but sit on the ear (more or less), a bit more bass that would be lost through earbuds is captured. The result is a beautifully balanced sound with a round, solid but not overpowering bass.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin T.

customer_reviews.title: Compact, but good sound
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones to use when I go to the gym; I wanted some that are compact and will pack in my bag a little easier than some larger ones I have. They don't 'fold up,' so I was a little disappointed - but they go flat and do pack in my bag pretty well. The sound quality is quite good. A good deal on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: VAPetlover

customer_reviews.title: My default headphones .
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these headphones since they came out on the market , I have also expensive ones from Logitech , Bose , JBL and Sennheiser but there's something about this little thing that makes me very dependent on them , I'm not complaining at all , it feels very good to be dependent on something that you really like .
customer_reviews.author: armando cardenas

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and comfortable headset!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the headset for my last trip on a plane. Now I use them occasionally at home and road trips because of the low profile and convenience. They have a great sound, comfortable and look good. This JVC flat headset is smaller and the way the speakers can be folded flat can be stored easily. The headset padding is actually good quality and comfortable as well. I have had them for several months now and it is still good and I have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: JP25

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get use to the fit
customer_reviews.text: I liked the price. It does have a great sound. But as for the comfort on the ears still trying to find the sweet spot.☹ I dislike the fact that the cables end up spiraling up on themselves going up to the earpieces.☹ I wish they had used a different cabled coating which wasn't so soft and grippy & then they may not do this. The true solution would have been flat coated cables that are tangle proof.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Nice and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these headphones. The last pair I had for 3 years, and still worked fine. The leather got old and started to peel off. Replacing them only because I didn't like little bits of leather sticking to my ears. I'll buy these again if it happens again. Like I said, nice and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Potter

customer_reviews.title: I like these.
customer_reviews.text: When i first opened the package i was very upset. They we so small i though " These are made for kids" as they are small in size. Bit i put them on and listened. They actually sound decent considering they are under $10. The thing i really like is they are slim and i actually fall asleep watching my computer . I am astonished when i wake up of a morning and they are still on my head. I really like these.
customer_reviews.author: Barry K Duncan

product_meta.title: JVC HAS160R Flat Headphones - Red
product_meta.description: Color:RedThe JVC HA-S160 FLATS are stylish, compact headphones with a slim metallic headband and sleek, soft ear pads that rest on the ear. The earpieces pivot so that the headphone can lie flat, making them ideal for listeners who want a lightweight, easily packable headphone, but who prefer a headband/on-the-ear style. A 30mm Neodymium driver in each earpiece allows the headphones to deliver clear, crisp sound. And the soft ear pads further enhance sound quality by providing a seal against ambient sound. The JVC HA-S160 Flats come in six iPod matching colors: black, white, red, violet, blue and pink. The headphones come with a four-foot (1.2m) cord and an iPhone -compatible plug.
feature_bullets: SOFT ON EAR PADS - Soft Ear Pads for Sound Isolation and Comfort Fit.
STAINLESS STEEL HEAD FIT SIZE EXPANDER - Rugged Stainless Steel for Perfect Head Fit. Large Head, Medium Head or Small Head Headphones.
FLAT FOLDABLE CUSTOM DESIGN - Headphone Ear Pieces Swivel for Small Storage. Less than 1 inch Thick When Folded. Easy to carry in a purse, backpack, or Briefcase
POWERFUL SOUND - 30MM Neodymium Driver Units for a Rich Fidelity Sound.
GOLD PLATTED HEADPHONE JACK - 3.94 Foot Cord with Gold Plated Headphone Jack.
